abstract.p: Police raid Point of Sale Technology, purported computer company, and find it grows marijuana in commercial Manhattan building; arrest Moses Newman and Jill Newman (S)

block.p: An operation thought to be a computer company in Manhattan turned out to be a marijuana farm, the police said.
Point of Sale Technology, a tenant in a commercial building at 34 East 29th Street, purported to be a computer company, the police said.
An operation thought to be a computer company in Manhattan turned out to be a marijuana farm, the police said.
Point of Sale Technology, a tenant in a commercial building at 34 East 29th Street, purported to be a computer company, the police said.

But investigators with a search warrant found an altogether different business there last night -- 850 marijuana plants, taking up almost the whole third floor of the building, plus five pounds of dried marijuana, said Detective Joseph Pentangelo. The garden had lamps, exhaust fans and watering hoses, he said.

Investigators from the Brooklyn district attorney's office also found two people there, Moses Newman, 34, and his wife, Jill Newman, 33, both of East 36th Street, Detective Pentangelo said. They were charged with drug and paraphernalia possession.
